course_title: Impact Academy 2: Designing Solutions that Create Value

learning_outcomes.description: Working individually or in teams, identify and critically evaluate the desirability, feasibility, and viability of a value creation opportunity by applying concepts, tools, and techniques and gathering supporting data.
Critically evaluate one’s own suitability and willingness to execute a value creation opportunity in light of new insights and data sensemaking.
Convey cogent value creation strategies developed through synthesis of and adaptation to stakeholder feedback and insights.

assessments.task_description:
You will pitch your idea (max 15 min, followed by Q&A) by analysing it against the backdrop of the concepts, tools, and techniques from the course including any initial validation and supporting evidence. Each student will present in class (given confidentially permits) and will respond to questions from the audience.

Please Note: The presentation will be recorded for marking purposes per UQ Policy.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: One member per team has to submit the slides via Blackboard BEFORE the pitch.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Throughout the course, you will keep a reflective journal of your opportunity journey. Five times throughout the course, you will reflect on the progress that you make and the successes and challenges you faced while developing your opportunities based on the concepts, tools, and techniques from the course. Individual reflections do not need to (but can) be longer than 200 words / 2–3 minutes video and include entry and exit reflections:

1. What new aspects did you add to your opportunity, and why?

2. What aspect of your opportunity did you abandon, and why?

3. What existing aspects of your opportunity will you double down on, and why?

assessments.assessment_title: Opportunity and Execution Pitch – Stakeholder Pitch
assessments.task_description:
You will deliver a max 7 min investor pitch followed by a 20-30 min explanation summarising the logic and evidence underlying the proposed solution and how it was informed by the insights gained throughout the course. Submission will be a video recording of the pitch and explanation accompanied by an extended slide deck including the pitch deck and complementary explanatory slides outlining the logic and evidence. The investor pitch must demonstrate that the opportunity is viable, feasible, and desirable.
